trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of external rotation of the leg on the size and accesssibility of the femoral vein
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of external rotation of the leg versus a neutral leg position on femoral vein diameter and degree of overlap by the femoral artery in stable patients presenting to the Emergency Department (ED).

conditions.healthcondition: Examination of effect of leg position on accessibility of femoral vein for femoral venous access

interventions.interventions: For each patient, the femoral vessels will be visualised using a vascular ultrasound probe with the leg in the neutral position and then with the leg externally rotated. Measurements will be made only once with the leg in each of these positions. This procedure will take approximately 10 minutes

primaryOutcome.outcome: Diameter of femoral vein in each position. Measurements will be made in real time. That is, the size and overlap over the vessels will be measured as soon as the leg has been placed in the selected position. The process of obtaining the ultrasound image takes 1-2 minutes but once the image is obtained, the measurements are made immediately on the frozen image.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Immediately upon obtaining a clear image of the femoral vein and artery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of overlap by femoral artery in each leg position. Both a) the total diameter of the vein and b) the diameter of the vein lying medial to the artery (ie not overlapped by the femoral artery) are measured in millimetres. The proportion of overlap is 1- (b/a).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Immediate - as above, the measurement is taken as soon as a clear image is obtained.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Stable patients presenting to the ED who are triaged to a bed as part of their usual care.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnancy Previous femoral vascular surgery or cannulation Critically unwell (altered level of consciousness, pulse rate greater than 120 beats per minute of systolic blood pressure less than 90mmHg

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Emergency Department Liverpool Hospital Elizabeth St Liverpool NSW 2170

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Observational study examining changes in femoral vessel relationship and size in two different leg positions

ethicscommitee.ethicname: SouthWest Sydney Area Health Service Ethics committee (western zone)
